roleset.name: make a cracking noise, making a joke, cracking sound
roleset.note: CRACK-V NOTES: There should be an ergative reading, but I can't get it. "Thunder cracked"? (from crack.01-v)
CRACK-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on more-nouns. (from crack.03-n)
CRACK-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on more-nouns, crack-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls sound_emission-43.2. (from crack.04-n)

roles.note: I don't think it's really possible to get both "a joke" and the subject matter of the joke in separate args. If you actually see one treed that way though, we should add an arg for the joke. (from crack.03-n)

example.name: ouch
example.text: John cracked his knuckles.

example.name: jokes also crack
example.text: The newspaper boys cracked jokes and again Barco 's pride was aroused [*-1] .

example.name: without causer
example.text: The cracking of the floorboards beneath their heavy boots indicated that the house was very old.

example.name: with causer
example.text: His cracking his knuckles all the time drove Delilah to throw Jeremy off a cliff one day.

example.name: just arg1
example.text: Mr. Cathcart says he has had `` a lot of fun '' at Kidder , adding the crack about his being a `` tool - and - die man '' never bothered him
example.arg: about his being a `` tool - and - die man ''

example.name: just arg1
example.text: The pitch sailed toward Bobby Thomson high and inside and then , with a crack of the bat , was sent rocketing back into the lower leftfield stands .

example.name: both args
example.text: his crack of the whip gives pleasure to the audience as well as pain.

roleset.name: break, but not into pieces
roleset.note: CRACK-V NOTES: Frames file for 'crack' based on sentences in financial subcorpus andautomatic expansion via verbnet. (from crack.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: transitive
example.text: But new-product development will make Japanese companies stronger, and big investments in ``domestic'' industries such as beer will make it even tougher for foreign competitors to crack the Japanese market.

example.name: now that's ugly
example.text: John cracked the mirror with his ugliest face.

example.name: Arg0, 1
example.text: Billy's cracking his iPhone cost him an arm and a leg.

roleset.name: hit
roleset.note: CRACK-V NOTES: VN classes bump 18.4-1, spank 18.3 (from crack.05-v)

example.name: all args
example.text: She had taken him out of the schoolhouse and closed the school for the summer , after she saw Miss Snow crack Joel across the face with a ruler for [*] letting a snake loose in the schoolroom .
example.arg: for [*] letting a snake loose in the schoolroom

example.name: Arg0, 1, 2
example.text: Todd's cracking the bat at that last pitch was impressive.

roleset.name: try
roleset.note: CRACK-N NOTES: Added due to expansion of Nombank. Comparison to 'attempt' VN class try-61. No Fn class. Framed by Katie. (from crack.01-n)

example.name: LVC-have
example.text: The plaintiff had first crack at me

example.name: LVC-take
example.text: The few big state farms take first crack at what does get made.

roleset.name: crack up: cause hilarity, causing hilarity

example.name: all args
example.text: John cracked Mary up with his Elvis impersonation.

example.name: just laugher
example.text: Mary cracked up when she saw John's Elvis impersonation.
example.arg: when she saw John's Elvis impersonation

roleset.name: crack up: go crazy, go crazy

example.name: automatically generated
example.text: One beatnik got the woman [0] he was living with [*T*-1]so involved in drugs and self-analysis and all-night sessions of sex-2 that she was beginning [*-2] to crack up .
Martha informed the Secret Service about what she overheard but they dismissed it, saying it was just a sign of Martha's cracking up.

roleset.name: punish something more harshly, suppress, harsher punishment, becoming strict
roleset.note: CRACK_DOWN-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on more-nouns, crack_down-v.06. No VNcls. (from crack.02-n)
CRACKDOWN-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. (from crackdown.01-n)

example.name: All Args
example.text: *T* Cracking down on crime and stamping out "black gold" politics remains a central plank of the new government's platform.

example.name: Arg0, 1
example.text: Denver police are cracking down on distracted drivers.

example.name: arg1
example.text: The Egyptian government has carried out a vigorous crack - down on the Islamist group , which says it takes peaceful means to bring about an Islamic government .
example.arg: on the Islamist group , which says it takes peaceful means to bring about an Islamic government

example.name: both args
example.text: China: authorities must end their crackdown on Tibetan Buddhism.
